The creature's emotions become cold and numb; it gains advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} but disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks.

reaction.name: Condemn Fire
entries: The elemental can force a creature within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell that can deal fire damage to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} cold damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

reaction.name: Heinous Reprisal
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack that deals fire damage, the elemental can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

monster.name: Horde Of Zombies
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

action.name: Gnaw and Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and considered {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The hound can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Ice Spikes (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The hound magically summons ice spikes out of the ground. Each creature within 5 feet of the hound of the wild hunt must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the huskarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Deadly Strike (1/Turn)
entries: Any hit with a melee weapon attack the huskarl scores against a {@condition prone} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The huskarl can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The huskarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The huskarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huskarl makes either three melee attacks - two with its longsword and one with its spiked shield - or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Shield
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Bulwark
entries: When an ally the huskarl can see within 5 feet of it is attacked, the huskarl switches places with the ally. The two ally swap places, and the huskarl becomes the target instead.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Etherealness
entries: The wraith enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa with a bonus action. The wraith is {@condition invisible} while on the Border Ethereal and it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shadow Being
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the wraith has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, one with its sapping tether and two with its shadow claws.

action.name: Shadow Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Sapping Tether
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) psychic damage and the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target gains a hym's indefinite madness if this reduces its Wisdom to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

legendary.name: Shadow Step
entries: The wraith magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the next melee attack before the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Torment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets on creatures with hym's indefinite madness that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Rip Shadow (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to the wraith and within 30 feet of it. If the target fails a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the wraith's commands, acting on the initiative count of the wraith. A greater restoration spell or a remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wraith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The wraith can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Deadly Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the ice wraith can make a Freezing Bite attack as a bonus action and has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ice wraith is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Snowy Stealth
entries: While in a snowy environment, the ice wraith has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Freezing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or for 1 minute, take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns, its speed is halved; it can take either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both; and it can't take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Slither Away
entries: The ice wraith adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the ice wraith must see the attacker. If the attack misses, the ice wraith moves up to its speed and doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

monster.name: Ignis Fatuus
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the foglet's body is destroyed, a will-o'-wisp appears in its space. If the will-o'-wisp escapes, after 24 hours, it will inhabit another corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points, turning into a new foglet. Destroying the will-o'- wisp prevents the foglet from returning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The foglet makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Killer Fog {@recharge 5}
entries: The foglet call forth a fog haunted by smoke doubles of itself. A 30-foot-radius fog appears, centered on a point within 60 feet of the foglet and lasting for 1 minute or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. A creature's speed is halved in the area. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage as illusory foglets attack it from every side. Foglets are immune to these effects.

action.name: Summon Wisp {@recharge 5}
entries: The ignis fatuus can summon {@dice 1d4} will-o'-wisp, a summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the foglet, acts as an ally of its foglet. It remains for l minute, until it or its foglet dies, or until the foglet dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The foglet's innate spellcasting ability is wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). The foglet can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: First Axe
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the jarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The jarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The jarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The jarl regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jarl makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the jarl scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jarl adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jarl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Marked for Death
entries: The jarl targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The next attack roll made against this target before the end of the jarl's next turn has advantage.

legendary.name: Deathblow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jarl makes one weapon attack. If it hits, the attack deals maximum damage and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Unleash the Fury (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the jarl that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Etherealness
entries: As a bonus action, the jormungandr magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the jormungandr is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Snowy Stealth
entries: While in a snowy environment, the jormungandr has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jormungandr makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Freezing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or for 1 minute, take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage at start of each of its turns, its speed is halved; it can take either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both; and it can't take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Ouroboros {@recharge 5}
entries: The jormungandr bites its own tail and start spinning on itself, opening a rift of supernatural frost to the Frostfell. Each creature within 10 feet of the jormungandr must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be trapped by the rift. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue in the Frostfell. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target remains there until the effect ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph in to a Medium humanoid or back into its true form. While in humanoid form, its statistics, are the same. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The vampire can automatically smell blood within the range of its blindsight. The vampire can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened} and unable to smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. During daylight hours the regeneration of the vampire is reduced to 10 hit points.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
Blood Addiction: In the presence of the blood of its favorite type of prey the vampire has disadvantage on blood frenzy saving throws.

Garlic Aversion: The vampire has a strong aversion to the smell of garlic, it cannot use its blindsight when garlic is present within its blindsight range and if the vampire comes within 5 feet of a clove of garlic it is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack or it makes two melee attack and turn {@condition invisible} before or after the attack.

action.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d12 + 8}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or lose 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to internal injuries. Each time the vampire hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Greater Invisibility
entries: The vampire magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the vampire wears or carries is invisible with it.

variant.name: Supernatural Smelling
entries: Katakans are known for their ability to smell and track their favorite prey over great distances. Though not necessarily reflected in term of rules, it should be clear that they can detect preys from very far, potentially several miles away, depending on the conditions. This is especially true when it comes to the scent of blood. If you wish to confine the ability to a more defined set of rules we suggest replicating the effects of the locate creature spell. This ability should also be impeded by the katakan profound disgust for garlic's smell.

legendary.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. The vampire can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its move inside an object.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Darkness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire casts darkness, no concentration requiered.

legendary.name: Fear the Night (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, when the creature is in dim light or darkness, it is {@condition frightened} and can't regain hit points. The curse lasts until it is removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a claws attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kikimore has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kikimore's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swarm Mind
entries: While the kikimore can see a warrior or queen kikimore friendly to it, the kikimore ignores the effects of being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

monster.name: Kikimore Queen
senses: blindsight 60 ft. or 10 ft. while deafened (blind beyond this radius)

trait.name: Pheromone Aura
entries: If a creature that isn't an undead, construct, or elemental starts its turn within 20 feet of the kikimore, the kikimore can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the kikimore isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature suffers from one of the following effects, chosen by the kikimore:

Aggression: The creature becomes {@condition charmed} until the start of its next turn; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. While {@condition charmed} by the kikimore, the creature has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

Threat: The creature becomes {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition frightened}, it must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from the kikimore. The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

Pacified: The creature is {@condition charmed}, and is {@condition incapacitated} while {@condition charmed} in this way. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Virulent Venom
entries: If the kikimore deals poison damage to a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage taken. If this effect reduces the target hit point maximum to 0, it has disadvantage on death saving throws. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest, unless the target is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kikimore makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the kikimore. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kikimore, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the kikimore's turns. The kikimore can have only up to two creatures swallowed at a time.

If the kikimore takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kikimore must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kikimore. If the kikimore dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 4d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small kikimore. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Virulent Venom
entries: If the kikimore deals poison damage to a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage taken. If this effect reduces the target hit point maximum to 0, it has disadvantage on death saving throws. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest, unless the target is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Aggression Pheromone
entries: If a creature that isn't an undead, construct, or elemental starts its turn within 5 feet of the kikimore, the kikimore can force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw if the kikimore isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the target becomes {@condition charmed} until the start of its next turn, a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. While {@condition charmed} by the kikimore, the creature has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the kikimore's Aggression Pheromone for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Fortitude
entries: The kikimore has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Virulent Venom
entries: If the kikimore deals poison damage to a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage taken. If this effect reduces the target hit point maximum to 0, it has disadvantage on death saving throws. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest, unless the target is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} creature must repeat the saving throw every 24 hours, taking 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage on a failed save. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

reaction.name: Stalwart
entries: When the kikimore is subjected to an effect that would move it, knock it {@condition prone} or stun it, it can use its reaction to be neither moved, {@condition stunned} nor knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kikimore has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kikimore's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swarm Mind
entries: While the kikimore can see a warrior or queen kikimore friendly to it, the kikimore ignores the effects of being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Virulent Venom
entries: If the kikimore deals poison damage to a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage taken. If this effect reduces the target hit point maximum to 0, it has disadvantage on death saving throws. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest, unless the target is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Bringer of Death
entries: Any creature hostile to the king that starts its turn within 20 feet of the king must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw, unless the king is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature has disadvantage on all saving throws. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the king's Bringer of Death for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: White Frost Weapons
entries: The king's weapon attacks are magical. When the king hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage and {@dice 4d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king can use its Proclaim Edict. It then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Proclaim Edict
entries: The king targets up to three creatures that it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. In case of failure the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the king:

1. Edict of Death. The next time the target is taking damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an equal amount and the Edict ends for it. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

2. Edict of Despair. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw, the target must roll a {@dice d10} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw and the Edict ends for it.
3. Edict of Obedience. If the target makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and the Edict ends for it.

variant.name: Spectral King
entries: With this option, the king has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP) and the following trait:

entries.name: Spectral King (1/Day)
entries: As an action, the king psionically transform into the spectral king (see spectral hunt section), and can remain in this form for up to 12 hours. The king can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The king can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn. The king assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, the king returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the king's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}. While in this new form, the king retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Constitution and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, reactions and legendary actions that the new form has but that it lacks.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The king magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Command the Hunt (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the king that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

legendary.name: Screaming Vortex (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The king targets a space that it can see within 60 feet of it. A vertical column of White Frost energies erupts from a dimensional rift at the location. Each creature in a 10- foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be trapped by the vortex. While trapped, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it dies and no mortal magic can return that creature to life. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target remains there until the effect ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If the effect ends for a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or acquires a long-term madness randomly determined.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The king's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}). The king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Heart Sight
entries: As a bonus action, the leanan can choose one creature she can see within 60 feet of her and magically knows the creature's alignment, current emotional state and ideal, as long as the creature isn't hidden from divination magic by a spell or other magical effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leanan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leanan can use her Exhilarating Gaze. She then makes three attacks: one with her ram and two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Exhilarating Gaze
entries: The leanan's eyes sparkle with enchanting light as she targets one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the leanan, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the leanan's next turn. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, it is {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Kiss of the Wild
entries: The leanan kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by her or a willing creature. The target makes a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is transformed (as the polymorph spell) into the type of beast with a challenge rating of 1 or less that it identifies most with (creature's choice). In this form, the creature retains its mental ability scores and ability to speak. Whenever the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. After three failed saving throws, the transformation can be undone only by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the target successfully saves against the effect, the target is immune to this leanan's Kiss of the Wild for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The leshen's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leshen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

trait.name: Totem Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the leshen can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one of his totem within its reach and emerge from a second totem within its territory, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second totem.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leshen makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Roots Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The leshen targets up to two creatures that it can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. When a creature ends its turn {@condition restrained} by this power it takes an extra 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage as the roots contract to crush it.

action.name: Call Primal Beast (2/Day)
entries: The leshen chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning. The leshen can summon {@dice 1d6} Primal Murder of Crows, {@dice 1d3 + 1} Primal Wolves or 1 Primal Bear. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the leshen, acts as an ally of its leshen. It remains for l hour, until it or its leshen dies, or until the leshen dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The leshen's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}). The leshen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The lubberkin can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Glow
entries: The lubberkin sheds bright light in a 5-to 20- foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The lubberkin can alter the radius as a bonus action. While inside the radius of bright light, a friendly creature gains a +3 bonus to its saving throws.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The lubberkin can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Kin Awareness
entries: The lubberkin knows the distance to and direction of any creature part of its family, even if the creature and the lubberkin are on different planes of existence. If a creature that is part of the family dies, the lubberkin knows.

action.name: Glowing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) radiant damage and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of the lubberkin's next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the melusina is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Kraken's Blessing
entries: The AC of the melusina includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The melusina can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The melusina makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail constrict.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the melusina can't constrict another target.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The melusina covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a beautiful man or woman of it general size and shape. The effect ends if the siren takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the melusina could appear to have no claws, but someone touching its hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the siren is disguised.

legendary.name: Retreat
entries: The melusina moves up to half its flying or swimming speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The melusina makes one attack with its claws.
Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions). The melusina cast a spell from its list of Innate Spellcasting or Spellcasting feature, using a daily use or a spell slot as normal.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The melusina is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

entries: As a bonus action, the leanan can choose one creature she can see within 60 feet of her and magically knows the creature's alignment, current emotional state and ideal, as long as the creature isn't hidden from divination magic by a spell or other magical effect.

If the target can see the leanan, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the leanan's next turn. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, it is {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Kiss of the Wild
entries: The leanan kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by her or a willing creature. The target makes a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is transformed (as the polymorph spell) into the type of beast with a challenge rating of 1 or less that it identifies most with (creature's choice). In this form, the creature retains its mental ability scores and ability to speak. Whenever the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. After three failed saving throws, the transformation can be undone only by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the target successfully saves against the effect, the target is immune to this leanan's Kiss of the Wild for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The satyr is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 14}). The satyr has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The swarm can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Unruly
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

reaction.name: Countercharge
entries: In response to a creature entering its reach, the swarm can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The swarm can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Unruly
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes three improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
