entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage.

trait.name: Destructive
entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes three improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Inspirational Ideals {@recharge 4}
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of the swarm that can hear it can use their reactions to be freed from any charm and fright effect.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Impetuous
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move toward the nearest and most obvious seat of power. The swarm moves toward the seat of power by the most direct route.

trait.name: Sworn Enemy
entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage.

trait.name: Destructive
entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes four improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Inspirational Ideals {@recharge 4}
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of the swarm that can hear it can use their reactions to be freed from any charm and fright effect.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The rider's weapon attacks are magical. When the rider hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Unicorn Slayer
entries: When the rider hits a celestial with a weapon attack, the celestial takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage of the weapon's type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rider makes two attacks.

action.name: Loa'then Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or it can't regain hit points until the curse is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. If the spear is thrown, it immediately flies back in the rider's hands after the attack.

action.name: Summon Hounds (1/Day)
entries: The rider attempts to magically summon {@dice 1d4 + 1} hound of the wild hunt with a 50 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the rider takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned hounds appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of its summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

reaction.name: Frost Globe (2/Day)
entries: When the rider is hit by an attack, it becomes surrounded by a frost globe that has 50 hit points. Whenever the rider takes damage, the globe takes the damage instead. If a creature hits the globe with a melee attack, the creature takes 10 cold damage. If the globe is reduced to 0 hit points, the rider takes any remaining damage. While the globe remains, the rider is {@condition incapacitated} and regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rider's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blinding Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the morvudd's third eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the morvudd, the morvudd can force it to make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw if the morvudd isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the morvudd until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the morvuud in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

trait.name: Devastating Charge
entries: If the morvudd moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antler attack on the same turn, the target takes and extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the morvudd can make another attack with its claws against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the morvudd fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The morvudd regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The morvudd use its Third Eye and makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 5d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 5d10 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 5d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Third Eye
entries: The morvudd magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it comes under one of the following effects, chosen at random:
1. Asleep. The target falls {@condition unconscious}. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.

2. Madness. The target is {@condition charmed}. The {@condition charmed} creature behaves as if under the effects of the confusion spell during combat. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

3. Weakened. The creature has disadvantage on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Feeblemind. The target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. At the end of each day, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect can also be ended by greater restoration, heal, or wish.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The morvudd moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The morvudd makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Third Eye (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The morvudd uses its Third Eye.

legendary.name: Eye Ray (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The morvudd targets a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes three improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the rotfiend dies, it explodes in a burst of toxic fumes. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 8 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage plus 8 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than a undead that starts its turn within 5 feet of the rotfiend must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all rotfiends for 1 hour.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the devourer dies, it explodes in a burst of toxic fumes. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 8 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage plus 8 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Unbearable Stench
entries: Any creature other than a undead that starts its turn within 5 feet of the rotfiend must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned}, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devourer makes two rotting fist attacks.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The griffin doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The griffin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The griffin's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The royal griffin uses its Stunning Screech, if available and makes four melee attacks: one with its beak, two with its claws and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the griffin can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Stunning Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The griffin emits a powerful screech. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the griffin's next turn.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The griffin moves up to its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Majestic Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: An aura of grace and majesty radiates from the griffin. Each creature within 30 feet of the griffin that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} until the end of the griffin's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the griffin's aura for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The royal griffin makes a claws attack against each creature within 10 feet of it.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the scurver dies, it explodes, flinging spines out at great speed. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Razor Spines
entries: A creature that touches the scurver or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scurver makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The raider can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The northlander is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Wall of Shields
entries: When the raider is within 5 feet of a creature that has the Mariner trait and is bearing a shield, it can use their reaction to make a wall of shields. The involved raider and creature gain half cover, provided they are bearing a shield.

monster.name: Shade

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shade can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: As a bonus action, the shade magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to a space it can see. It can also turn {@condition invisible} until it attacks, either before or after it teleports. If the shade takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of the shade's next turn.

trait.name: Shade Weaknesses
entries: The shade has the following flaws:

Repelled by Salt: The shade can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means. If the shade tries to use teleportation to do so, it must first succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. Whether or not the attempt is successful, the shade takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity: The shade takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the shade had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Shade Host
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The shade host can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The shade host can't gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Howling Hatred
entries: The shade host emits a horrific howl while it can see any living creature and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the shade host and can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the shade host, if able. On a 5 or 6, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a 7 or 8, the creature is overwhelmed with despair until the start of its next turn. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade host can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shade Host Weaknesses
entries: The shade host has the following flaws:
Repelled by Salt: The shade host can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity: The shade host takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade host makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The shade host targets a humanoid within its space that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter that becomes part of the shade host, the shade host regains 22 ({@dice 5d8}) hit points. While the specter is part of the shade host, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: All zombies within 5 miles of the shambling lord are tied into an instinctive hive mind, linked to the lord. Within the range of the telepathic bond, the shambling lord can see through the eyes of any zombie, hear what it hears and speak through it. It can cast spells as though it were in the zombie's space, and can mentally command any zombie within reach (if it controls multiple creatures, it can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shambling lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The zombie regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zombie takes radiant damage or a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zombie's next turn. The shambling lord is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Well of Knowledge
entries: The shambling lord can recollect all the knowledges and memories stored in the collective hive mind of its hordes or the brains it devoured. It has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom skill checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling lord uses its Shambling Hordes feature, if available, and makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Psychic Assault
entries: The shambling lord magically assault the mind of three targets it can see within 90 feet of it. A target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the zombie's next turn.

action.name: Shambling Hordes {@recharge 5}
entries: The shambling lord can summon one horde of zombies, a summoned horde appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the shambling lord, acting as an ally. It remains for l minute, until it or the shambling lord dies, or until the shambling lord dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The shambling lord's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}). The zombie can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The maiden can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The maiden can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The maiden is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses the maiden with a melee weapon attack, the maiden can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature

trait.name: Clumsy Moves
entries: While the siren is neither flying nor swimming, attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The siren can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siren makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the siren can grapple the target (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the siren can't use its tail against another target.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The siren covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a beautiful man or woman of it general size and shape. The effect ends if the siren takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the siren could appear to have no claws, but someone touching its hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the siren is disguised.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dryad can use her action to polymorph into a Medium beautiful female elf., or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dryad makes two attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Tree Merge
entries: In response to another creature dealing damage to the dryad, the dryad reduces the damage to 0 by stepping magically into one living tree and emerge in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the tree. To do so, the dryad must see the attacker and have a Large or bigger tree within her reach. If the dryad takes fire damage or damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function until the end of the dryad's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The skald has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The skald can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The skald is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Shout of Valor (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skald can utter a powerful warcry. For 1 minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a damage roll. The creature can add a {@dice d6} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the skald. A creature can benefit from only one Shout of Valor die at a time. This effect ends if the skald is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skald makes two melee attacks or two ranged attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Horn {@recharge 5}
entries: The skald blows in its horn. Each hostile creature within 120 feet of the skald that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the skald's next turn or until the skald is {@condition incapacitated}. A {@condition frightened} target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skald must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the skald as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the safest available route away from the skald. A target that successfully saves is immune to the War Horn of all skalds for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral hunt takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Herald of the Void
entries: At the start of each of the spectral hunt's turns, each creature within its space must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Void Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points.

action.name: White Frost's Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) cold damage. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral hunt takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Herald of the Void
entries: At the start of each of the spectral hunt's turns, each creature within its space must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spectral hunt makes two melee attacks. When its Soul Tear is available, it can use it in place of one attack.

action.name: Void Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points.

action.name: White Frost's Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) cold damage. If the target is killed by this damage, it becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

action.name: Soul Tear {@recharge 5}
entries: The spectral hunt targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it.The target must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, taking 61 ({@damage 7d8 + 30}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

variant.name: Soul Torment
entries: Soul Torment is a curse that afflicts a creature whose soul is being slowly torn apart by vile magic. If the target dies out of {@condition exhaustion}, the target's soul is destroyed and ceases to exist, preventing any use of resurrection magic on the creature. The curse lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
For every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
While cursed, the creature is unable to sleep and the curse prevents the target from gaining any benefit from resting.
The creature's emotions become cold and numb; it gains advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} but disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks.

legendary.name: Boreal Winds
entries: The spectral hunt erupts into an icy whirlwind. Each creature within its space must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The spectral hunt may then move up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spectral hunt makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Flash Freeze (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The area within the hunt's space freezes instantly. Nonmagical fires in the area are extinguished, water in the area freezes, and the ground becomes difficult terrain. Spells that protect against cold damage are dispelled.

legendary.name: Glacial Vortex (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The spectral hunt chooses a point that it can see within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage and be {@condition petrified}, encased in ice, until the end of the spectral hunt's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage and isn't {@condition petrified}.

trait.name: Force Disruption
entries: Whenever the spectral king takes force damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spectral king can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the spectral king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spectral king makes three melee attacks. When its Soul Tear is available, it can use it in place of one attack.

action.name: Spectral Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) psychic damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Soul Tear {@recharge 4}
entries: The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it.The target must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, taking 61 ({@damage 7d8 + 30}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

variant.name: Soul Torment
entries: Soul Torment is a curse that afflicts a creature whose soul is being slowly torn apart by vile magic. If the target dies out of {@condition exhaustion}, the target's soul is destroyed and ceases to exist, preventing any use of resurrection magic on the creature. The curse lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
For every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
While cursed, the creature is unable to sleep and the curse prevents the target from gaining any benefit from resting.
The creature's emotions become cold and numb; it gains advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} but disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks.

legendary.name: Rend Mind
entries: The spectral king targets one creature afflict ed by soul torment and that it can see within 60 feet of the king. The creature must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if the creature is no longer afflicted by Soul Torment.

legendary.name: Phantasmal Killer (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The spectral king casts phantasmal killer (spell save {@dc 21}), no concentration required.

legendary.name: Soul Bound
entries: (Costs 2 Actions). The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the spectral king to the target. Whenever the spectral king takes damage, the target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spectral king takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether last until the end of the spectral king's next turn.

legendary.name: Doomsayer (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The spectral king targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Wood Aspect
entries: As a bonus action at the start of her turn, the spriggan can magically shapeshift into a wood aspect. The wood aspect lasts until the spriggan is {@condition incapacitated} or choose to end it. While transformed, the spriggan gains one of the following benefits of her choice:
Birch: Whenever the spriggan casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, she can cast it using a bonus action instead.
Oak: The spriggan's AC becomes 19 and she has resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage.
Willow: The spriggan is {@condition invisible} and leaves no physical evidence of her passage unless she wishes to. Tracking her is impossible except by magical means.

trait.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: The spriggan is considered to be both a fey and a plant creature to determine the way a spell or effect would affect her.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spriggan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The spriggan can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the spriggan can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spriggan makes three attacks.

action.name: Reaching Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

action.name: Thorns Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 90/180 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The spriggan magically animates one or two trees she can see within 60 feet of her. These trees have the same statistics as an awakened tree. An animated tree acts as an ally of the spriggan. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the spriggan dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the spriggan takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spriggan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The spriggan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the thane hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The thane can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The thane can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The thane is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Martial Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: The thane can deal an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the thane can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thane makes three melee attacks: one with its battleaxe and two with its longsword.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the thane scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The thane makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Inspire Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the creature gains 20 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Rally Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, it is freed from any charm and fright effect.

legendary.name: Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The thane moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and slams into it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Fey Resilience
entries: The nekker has advantage on saving throws against illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed} and magic can't put the nekker to sleep.

trait.name: Heart of the Swarm
entries: While the thornheart is alive, the other nekkers within 60 feet of it have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the thornheart's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Thorn Lurker
entries: The nekker can attempt to hide even when it is only lightly obscured by foliage. Additionally, the nekker can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thornheart uses it Thorn Charm and makes two claw attacks. It can use Thorns Volley in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thorns Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Thorn Charm
entries: The thornheart touches the thorn in its heart and target one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. That target must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. If the target succeeds on the saving throw, the nekker is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn and takes {@dice 2d6} psychic damage. In case of failure, the target suffers one of the following effects at random:

1. Mad Laughter. The target falls {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} and unable to stand up until the end of the thornheart's next turn and take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.
2. Bedeviled. Hooves, horns and fur grows on the target, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the thornheart's next turn.
3. Afflicted. The target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the thornheart's next turn as toads, spiders and snakes crowl out of it, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.
4. Foul's Gold. The target loses {@dice 2d6} gold pieces as they melt and take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target has no gold pieces, nothing happens.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the tormentor is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Psychic Weapons
entries: The tormentor's weapon attacks are magical. When the tormentor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tormentor makes two attacks, only one of which can be with its psychic whip.

action.name: Psyblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Psychic Whip
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) psychic damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 20 feet closer to the tormentor. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tormentor can't use its psychic whip on another target.

action.name: Soul Drain (Recharges 5–6)
entries: The tormentor targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that isn't an undead, elemental or construct. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 37 ({@damage 5d8 + 15}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the creature is cursed with Soul Torment (see Appendix).

variant.name: Fetch
entries: When a tormentor takes a hold of someone's soul, it can imprint a part of it in a simulacrum called a fetch. Created with the simulacrum spell, a fetch can only replicate a creature that is afflicted by Soul Torment from the tormentor. A tormentor can have five fetches at any one time, disregarding the limitation of the simulacrum spell. A fetch has the following traits:

entries.name: Perfect Replica
entries: A fetch can access the integrality of the memory from the creature it impersonates, mimicking perfectly its emotions and thoughts. When the fetch makes a Charisma check to impersonate, it can replace the number it rolls with a 15. Additionally, no matter what it says, magic that would determine if it is telling the truth indicates that it is being truthful.

entries.name: Twin Souls
entries: Whenever the fetch takes damage, the creature it impersonates must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the fetch takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature takes the other half.

entries.name: Psychic Report (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: While the fetch maintains concentration, for 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell), it telepathically transmits its memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence.

variant.name: Soul Torment
entries: Soul Torment is a curse that afflicts a creature whose soul is being slowly torn apart by vile magic. If the target dies out of {@condition exhaustion}, the target's soul is destroyed and ceases to exist, preventing any use of resurrection magic on the creature. The curse lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
For every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
While cursed, the creature is unable to sleep and the curse prevents the target from gaining any benefit from resting.
The creature's emotions become cold and numb; it gains advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} but disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks.

legendary.name: Psychic Leech
entries: One creature that the tormentor is grappling with its psychic whip takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and the tormentor regains hit points equal to that amount.

legendary.name: Torment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tormentor targets one creature afflicted by soul torment and that it can see within 30 feet of the tormentor. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn and the tormentor immediately recharges Soul Drain. While {@condition frightened} in this way, whenever the tormentor takes damage, the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the tormentor takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature takes the other half.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The tormentor's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The uhogguath can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the uhogguath can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The uhogguath can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ethereal Web
entries: The ground in a 30-foot radius around the uhogguath is covered in semi-solid ethereal webs, making the area difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the ethereal web until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uhogguath makes two melee attacks; one with its bite and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Drain Intellect {@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} humanoid {@condition grappled} by the uhogguath. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. At the end of a long rest, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this effect, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration spell cast on the target also ends the effect.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Fury
entries: While it has 100 hit points or lower, or the full moon is up in the sky, the werewolf has advantage on attack rolls. Additionally, the werewolf's melee attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.
Keen Hearing and Smell. The ulfhedinn has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The ulfhedinn has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Attacks
entries: The werewolf's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the werewolf moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the werewolf can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ulfhedinn uses its Frightful Presence, and makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft.,one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the werewolf's choice that is within 120 feet of the werewolf and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the werewolf's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The werewolf moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: The Beast Within (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ulfheddin targets one creature cursed with lycanthropy that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On failure, the creature instantly polymorph into its hybrid form, cannot shapeshift back to other forms, and is {@condition charmed} by the ulfhedinn. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Eye of Winter (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ulfheddin targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw, it is also {@condition petrified}, encaised in ice until the end of the werewolf's next turn.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: The swarm has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes four improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.name: Vargheist
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The vampire has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the vampire is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vampire doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach .

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Lore Keeper
entries: The volva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The volva can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The volva is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Seeress
entries: The volva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the volva is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. While the volva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

Wand-Wed. The volva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the volva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a volva can use the staff.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 (l{@dice d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (l{@dice d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tormenting Vision
entries: The volva targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the volva:
The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of the volva's next turn.

On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
The target falls {@condition unconscious} until the end of its next turn. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The voref regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the werewolf takes damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werewolf's next turn.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the werewolf is killed, it regains all its hit points in 24 hours, unless wolfsbane is placed on its body, in which case it will take {@dice 1d10} days to rejuvenate. If silver pierces the heart of the werewolf during the full moon, the werewolf is truly dead.

trait.name: Voref Weaknesses
entries: The voref has the following flaws:

Call of the Moon: During the night of the full moon the true nature of the voref is revealed. The creature automatically polymorph into its hybrid form and acts according to its alignment. The werewolf is also free to ignore its master's order during these nights.
Voice of the Master: The voref is completely under the thrall of the person that cursed it. It is considered under the permanent effects of the dominate monster spell from its master.

Wolsbane Allergy: If the werewolf comes within 20 feet of aconitum flowers it is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area. Weapons coated with aconitum oil ignore the damage invulnerabilities of the werewolf.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The voref can use its Howl at the Moon. It then makes three melee attacks: one with its cursed bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the werewolf has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Cursed Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft.,one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the werewolf has more than half of its total hit points remaining. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target can't regain hit points and has vulnerability to all damage. Greater restoration, remove curse, or similar magic ends the curse on the target.

Howl at the Moon (Hybrid Form Only; Recharge 5–6). The werewolf howls with an insane look in its eyes. All creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be under the effects of a confusion spell for one minute. At the end of each of its turn a creature can reattempt the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

monster.name: Warp Spawn
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the spawn and can see it, the spawn can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the spawn isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of of its turns to remove the madness. A creature which already has a short term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw against this spawn's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Warp Form
entries: The warp spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Whenever the spawn starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spawn is {@condition incapacitated} for one round as its thrashes between nightmarish forms.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The warp spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warp spawn uses its Mutated Beyond Reason and makes three melee attacks; one with its bite, one with its claws and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Mutated Beyond Reason
entries: The warp spawn mutates and selects one of the options below.
1. Deadly Mutation. The spawn moves from its speed and makes a tentacle attack.

2. Eldritch Burst. Great bolts of eldritch energy are arcing out of the warp spawn. A line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
3. Regeneration. The warp spawn regains 10 hit points.

reaction.name: Mask of Insanity
entries: When a creature the spawn can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the aberration, the spawn can wrap its mind in psychic terror. If the creature can see the spawn, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Detect Heat
entries: The elemental can magically sense the presence of heat sources, including warm-blooded creatures, up to 5 miles away. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Drain Warmth
entries: When a creature of the elemental's choice starts its turn within 60 feet of the elemental, the elemental can force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw if the elemental isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage for 1 minute, until it has immunity to cold damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elemental's Drain Warmth for the next 24 hours. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Hurl Ice
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

variant.name: Pale Night
entries: When the Wild Hunt rides in the night sky or the pale dead stars are aligned, most conjurers know it is folly to call upon elemental servants. When a spellcaster attempt to summon an elemental creature with a spell such as con jure elemental, it must make on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell conjures a hostile white frost elemental, as if it had lost concentration on its spell.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The general's weapon attacks are magical. When the general hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Juggernaut
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the general hits with it (included in the attack). The general deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Pain Indifference
entries: The general's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The general can use its Booming Teleport or Inspire Dread. It then makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the general's next turn.

action.name: Booming Teleport
entries: The general, along with any objects it is wearing or carrying, teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 5 feet of the general before it teleports must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half the force damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Inspire Dread (Recharges 5–6)
entries: The general exudes magical terror. Any creature hostile to the general within 30 feet of the general must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for l minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. If a {@condition frightened} target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the general, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The general's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The general can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: War Magic
entries: When a member of the honor guard uses its action to cast a cantrip, it can also take a bonus action to make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The warrior's weapon attacks are magical. When the warrior hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

variant.name: Corsair
entries: Corsairs spend most of their time on naglfar ships, sailing the Astral Sea and honing their skills in skirmishes against githyanki warriors, githzekai monks and other creatures of this dangerous plane. A corsair has a challenge rating of 5 (1,800 XP) and the following additional traits:

entries.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: On its turn, the corsair can take one additional action and a possible bonus action.

entries.name: Endless Hunt (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the corsair takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points, it immediately regains 20 hit points.

entries.name: Honor Guard
entries: A corsair that is part of the honor guard (see the "Honor Guard" sidebar, in the Navigator section) has a challenge rating of 7 (2,900 XP).

variant.name: Ritual Hunt
entries: Twenty or more warriors of the Wild Hunt and one navigator within 30 feet of each other can magically form the mind chorus. Each of them must use its action and movement for 10 minutes to enter a trance state and must maintain concentration while doing so (as if concentrating on a spell). When all have finished, the spectral hunt begins, materializing on the other plane. The material body of the warriors are {@condition unconscious}. Any damage or other effects that apply to the spectral hunt have no effect on the warriors's physical body, nor do they persist when they return to it. The spectral hunt can remain for 1 hour, until it or all its participants die, or until the navigator dismisses it as a bonus action. If the spectral hunt is destroyed or the navigator loses it concentration, all the participants are suffering from the psychic winds mental effects, failing automatically the saving throw (p.48 of the Dungeon's Master Guide). A warrior can't enter the trance again until it finishes a long rest.

reaction.name: Arcane Rush
entries: After a magical teleport the warrior can make one melee weapon attack with advantage.

spellcasting.name: Shared Spellcasting
headerEntries: While members of the honor guard are within 60 feet of a navigator, they can each cast the following spells but must share the daily uses among themselves:
footerEntries: For casting these spells, each member of the honor guard is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Charisma as its spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the member's Charisma modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the member's Charisma modifier.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

entries: The warrior's weapon attacks are magical. When the warrior hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

The spectral hunt can remain for 1 hour, until it or all its participants die, or until the navigator dismisses it as a bonus action. If the spectral hunt is destroyed or the navigator loses it concentration, all the participants are suffering from the psychic winds mental effects, failing automatically the saving throw (p.48 of the Dungeon's Master Guide). A warrior can't enter the trance again until it finishes a long rest.

entries: After a magical teleport the warrior can make one melee weapon attack with advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warrior's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
